alert.note: Alert for Eddy; Lea (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued February 26 at 2:55PM MST until February 26 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Eastern Eddy County in southeastern New Mexico... Lea County in southeastern New Mexico... Northwestern Reeves County in southwestern Texas... Northeastern Culberson County in southwestern Texas... Northwestern Loving County in western Texas... * Until 600 PM CST/500 PM MST/. * At 354 PM CST/254 PM MST/, a dust channel was 10 miles north of Jal Airport, or 11 miles south of Eunice, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways Highway 18 between Lovington and Jal Highway 62 between Carlsbad and Hobbs Highway 380 between Caprock and Tatum Locations impacted include... Hobbs, Carlsbad, Lovington, Eunice, Jal, Tatum, Loving, Monument, Humble City, Maljamar, Crossroads, Eunice Airport, Jal Airport, Nadine, McDonald, Red Bluff Reservoir, Malaga, Caprock, Carlsbad North and Loco Hills. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
